humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there is metastatic ductal carcinoma found in one of the sentinel lymph nodes (Sentinel Lymph Node #2) with a size of 4 mm in diameter and focal extracapsular extension. This corresponds to N1 (New Rule 12) as per the AJCC staging system. The other sentinel lymph nodes (#1, #3, #4, #5, #6, and #7) were negative for malignancy. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer is determined by the involvement of lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has 1 out of 6 sentinel lymph nodes (node #2) positive for metastatic ductal carcinoma, which measures 4 mm in diameter with focal extracapsular extension. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
